description: Ability to deploy API services and store data in specific Google Cloud regions to meet data residency requirements.
Clear documentation and mechanisms to verify data storage and processing locations.
Controls to restrict data transfer outside of specified regions.
Mandatory strong TLS/SSL (e.g., TLS 1.2+) with configurable minimum versions and cipher suites.

Default encryption for all stored data, with support for Google-managed (GMEK), Customer-managed (CMEK), and Customer-supplied (CSEK) encryption keys, including key rotation and granular access controls.
Granular access control via Google Cloud IAM roles and policies.
Use of service accounts for programmatic access with least privilege.
Support for Multi-Factor Authentication for administrative access.
Support for OAuth 2.0 / OpenID Connect.
Secure generation, rotation, and revocation of API keys.
Support for private connectivity (e.g., Private Service Connect, VPC Service Controls).
Ability to configure ingress/egress firewall rules.
Built-in or configurable DDoS protection (e.g., Cloud Armor).
Centralized traffic management and security policies via API Gateway.
Comprehensive audit trails for all API calls and configuration changes.
Detailed access logs for API requests.
Integration with Cloud Monitoring for real-time metrics and security alerts.
Configurable log retention policies.
Google's commitment to regular patching and updates.
Evidence of regular vulnerability scanning and penetration testing.
Adherence to relevant industry standards (e.g., ISO 27001, SOC 2, HIPAA, GDPR).
Availability of compliance reports.
Integration with DLP services.
Ability to mask or redact sensitive information.
Adherence to secure API design principles.
Evidence of secure coding practices and security testing.
